pages.text: Now we know why 2 $(l)Grey$() chickens can make a $(l)Black$(), but not all genes are that simple. If we want to really experiment with them we will need a way to see (and edit) the genes of a chicken. Luckely we can make use of the $(l:laboratory/laboratory_view_entry) laboratory $() to do just that (click the link and read the instruction on how to use the $(item)Laboratory$() to see genes).
Now use the $(item)Laboratory$() to figure out which base sequence results in a $(l)Black$() gene and which results in a $(l)White$() gene. The gene you are looking for is gene 1 in chromosome 1.
